intro: Atuna latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf atuna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies due to their medicinal properties. Atuna latifolia thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade.
